column4: Hi, I get this error when I login, "Unable to find Internet Address please add (system name) to you /etc/hosts file to solve this problem", I am connecting via a wireless device that uses ndiswrapper, and it shows the link light on and blinking which means that it is connected to the router
do you have an IP, can you ping exteral IPs
do you have an IP from your router
yes it does give me one
ok, seems like your router is blocking your IP
I ping gogle.com and get "unknown host gogle.com"
right, because it cannot resolve the hostname to a DNS
yes, either that or your router/modem isn't working at all
I can probably figure it out then, thanks
check to see if you have a MAC address list set up on the router
